intro: Scelochilus portillae, commonly known as the Portilla's scelochilus, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
